meanings.definition: A high degree of pleasure or enjoyment
meanings.sent1: The children's faces lit up with delight when they saw the colorful balloons.
meanings.sent2: The movie brought her great delight as she laughed and smiled throughout.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's antics never failed to bring delight to the family.
meanings.sent4: The garden in full bloom was a visual delight for all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the freshly baked cookies was a pure delight to her senses.

meanings.sent1: She will delight in the surprise birthday party we planned for her.
meanings.sent2: The chef's special dish never fails to delight the customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks never fail to delight the audience, young and old.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song seemed to delight even the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected compliment from her friend truly delighted her heart.

meanings.definition: Something that gives great pleasure or enjoyment
meanings.sent1: The amusement park is a place of delight for families looking to have fun.
meanings.sent2: The book was a delightful escape into a world of fantasy and adventure.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream shop offered a variety of flavors to delight the customers.
meanings.sent4: The sunset over the ocean was a breathtaking delight for all who witnessed it.
meanings.sent5: The music festival was a sensory delight with its vibrant sounds and colors.
